intro: Fimbristylis pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf sedge, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Fimbristylis pusilla has small, inconspicuous flowers that develop into three-lobed capsules, and it often forms dense colonies in its native habitat. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
